metadata.code: National Building Code of Canada 2023 - Alberta Edition

requirements.description: This Section applies to floors supported on ground or on granular fill that do not provide structural support for the superstructure
requirements.exact_quote: This Section applies to floors supported on ground or on granular fill that do not provide structural support for the superstructure

requirements.description: Floors-on-ground that support loads from the superstructure shall be designed in conformance with Part 4
requirements.exact_quote: Floors-on-ground that support loads from the superstructure shall be designed in conformance with Part 4

requirements.description: All spaces within dwelling units, except crawl spaces, shall be provided with a floor-on-ground where access is provided and no structural floor is provided
requirements.exact_quote: All spaces within dwelling units, except crawl spaces, shall be provided with a floor-on-ground, where a) access is provided to the space, and b) a floor supported by the structure is not provided

requirements.description: Dampproofing and waterproofing shall conform to Section 9.13
requirements.exact_quote: Dampproofing and waterproofing shall conform to Section 9.13

requirements.description: Minimum thickness of coarse clean granular material beneath floors-on-ground
requirements.exact_quote: not less than 100 mm of coarse clean granular material containing not more than 10% of material that will pass a 4 mm sieve shall be placed beneath floors-on-ground

requirements.description: Maximum percentage of material that will pass a 4 mm sieve in granular fill
requirements.exact_quote: coarse clean granular material containing not more than 10% of material that will pass a 4 mm sieve

requirements.description: Granular material need not be installed under slabs in garages, carports, accessory buildings, or certain industrial buildings
requirements.exact_quote: Granular material need not be installed under a) slabs in garages, carports or accessory buildings, or b) buildings of industrial occupancy where the nature of the process contained therein permits or requires the use of large openings in the building envelope even during the winter

requirements.description: Material susceptible to volume changes from moisture or chemical-microbiological oxidation shall not be used as fill in damaging concentrations
requirements.exact_quote: Material that is susceptible to changes in volume due to variations in moisture content or chemical-microbiological oxidation shall not be used as fill beneath floors-on-ground in a concentration that will damage the building to a degree that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies

requirements.description: Material susceptible to volume changes from freezing shall not be used as fill beneath floors subject to freezing
requirements.exact_quote: Material that is susceptible to changes in volume due to freezing shall not be used as fill beneath floors-on-ground that will be subjected to freezing temperatures

requirements.description: Fill beneath floors-on-ground shall be compacted except for clean coarse aggregate
requirements.exact_quote: Except as provided in Sentence (4), fill beneath floors-on-ground shall be compacted

requirements.description: Fill need not be compacted where material is clean coarse aggregate with not more than 10% passing 4 mm sieve
requirements.exact_quote: Fill beneath floors-on-ground need not be compacted where the material is clean coarse aggregate containing not more than 10% of material that will pass a 4 mm sieve

requirements.description: Water ingress underneath a floor-on-ground shall be prevented by grading or drainage
requirements.exact_quote: Except as provided in Article 9.16.3.2. or where it can be shown to be unnecessary, ingress of water underneath a floor-on-ground shall be prevented by grading or drainage

requirements.description: Where groundwater may cause hydrostatic pressure beneath floor, it shall be poured concrete designed to resist such pressures
requirements.exact_quote: Where groundwater levels may cause hydrostatic pressure beneath a floor-on-ground, the floor-on-ground shall be a) a poured concrete slab, and b) designed to resist such pressures

requirements.description: When floor drains are required, floor surface shall be sloped so no water can accumulate
requirements.exact_quote: When floor drains are required (see Section 9.31.), the floor surface shall be sloped so that no water can accumulate

requirements.description: The finished surface of concrete floor slabs shall be trowelled smooth and even
requirements.exact_quote: The finished surface of concrete floor slabs shall be trowelled smooth and even

requirements.description: Dry cement shall not be added to floor surfaces to absorb surplus water
requirements.exact_quote: Dry cement shall not be added to the floor surfaces to absorb surplus water

requirements.description: Topping course shall consist of 1 part cement to 2.5 parts clean well-graded sand by volume, with water/cement ratio approximately equal to base slab
requirements.exact_quote: When a topping course is provided for a concrete floor slab, it shall consist of 1 part cement to 2.5 parts clean, well graded sand by volume, with a water/cement ratio approximately equal to that of the base slab

requirements.description: Minimum concrete topping thickness
requirements.exact_quote: When concrete topping is provided, it shall not be less than 20 mm thick

requirements.description: Minimum concrete slab thickness exclusive of topping
requirements.exact_quote: Concrete slabs shall not be less than 75 mm thick exclusive of concrete topping

requirements.description: A bond-breaking material shall be placed between the slab and footings or rock
requirements.exact_quote: A bond-breaking material shall be placed between the slab and footings or rock

requirements.description: Wood floors-on-ground shall conform to CSA S406
requirements.exact_quote: Floors-on-ground constructed of wood shall conform to CSA S406, "Specification of permanent wood foundations for housing and small buildings."
